channel.title: Home on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Home on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Test page
item.description: Should you adopt the newer “headless” approach to content management? Or stick with a traditional, monolithic system. While Content Management Systems (CMS) have been around for a long time, there have been some big changes in what’s on lately. Let’s explore the differences between the two approaches and look at how Sanity is an evolution of both. What is a Headless CMS? A headless CMS is a content management system that provides a way to author content, but instead of having your content coupled to a particular output (like web page rendering), it provides your content as data over an API.

item.title: What is headless?
item.description: Should you adopt the newer “headless” approach to content management? Or stick with a traditional, monolithic system. While Content Management Systems (CMS) have been around for a long time, there have been some big changes in what’s on lately. Let’s explore the differences between the two approaches and look at how Sanity is an evolution of both. What is a Headless CMS? A headless CMS is a content management system that provides a way to author content, but instead of having your content coupled to a particular output (like web page rendering), it provides your content as data over an API.

item.description: ĐÂY LÀ BLOG VỀ CỦA NHÓM AN VÀ TUẤN ĐỂ HOÀN THÀNH DỰ ÁN BÀI TẬP FONT-END CẢM ƠN ANH ĐÃ XEM

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
